description: Voting has started across Australia’s heavily-populated eastern coast in the 2025 election, with opinion polls indicating that Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is on track to become the first leader to win consecutive ballots in more than two decades.
title: Voting Starts in Australia Election With Albanese’s Labor Ahead

description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy told employees in a town hall Friday that he’s planning to reduce the department’s workforce at the end of this month.
title: Transportation Department Plans to Cut Workforce at End of May

description: Michael Gibson, director of the Federal Reserve’s supervision and regulation division, will leave at the end of the year following more than three decades at the US central bank, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Key Federal Reserve Supervision Official to Depart at Year-End

description: President Donald Trump will host a military parade marking the 250th birthday of the US Army — as well as his own 79th birthday — on June 14, the administration announced Friday.
title: Trump Will Celebrate Army’s Birthday - And His Own - With a Parade

description: The US approved the sale of weapons worth an estimated $3.5 billion to Saudi Arabia ahead of a planned visit by President Donald Trump to the Gulf kingdom this month, as Washington seeks to strengthen ties with a key partner and ratchet up pressure against Iran.
title: US Approves $3.5 Billion Weapons Sale to Saudi Arabia

description: The US State Department approved F-16 fighter-jet training and services for Ukraine worth up to $350 million, signaling that the White House will keep supporting Kyiv in the fight against Russia despite President Donald Trump’s impatience to end the war.
title: US Approves Up to $350 Million in Ukraine F-16 Training, Support

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Door Opens a Crack for Talks With China on Tariffs

description: The Trump administration asked the US Supreme Court to let Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency have access to sensitive Social Security information, escalating a privacy fight that could affect millions of people.
title: Trump Asks Supreme Court for DOGE Access to Social Security Data

description: New York fired a salvo in the fight to shield its congestion pricing program from the Trump administration’s push to shut it down, indicating it is now poised to seek an immediate court order in its lawsuit to protect the traffic tolling plan.
title: NY Fires Back in Congestion Fight With Trump to Keep Toll Alive

description: US antitrust enforcers reached back to a deal Google struck 15 years ago to argue that the Alphabet Inc. unit should once again share information with third parties, this time to end its illegal monopoly of online search.
title: US Presses for Google to Share Data by Citing Yahoo Japan Deal

description: Donald Trump’s promise to strip Harvard University of its tax-exempt status prompted criticism Friday from a former Internal Revenue Service commissioner in the president’s first term, who said the process would take years and need a judge’s approval.
title: Trump’s Ex-IRS Commissioner Pushes Back on Harvard Tax Attack

description: The US has reached a settlement in principle with the estate of Ashli Babbitt, the protester who was shot and killed by a police officer as she tried to force her way into the chambers of the House of Representatives during the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol riot.
title: US Reaches Settlement Over Rioter’s Death in Jan. 6 Attack

description: New Jersey Transit is on the brink of a “huge crisis” as a train engineers strike threatens to upend commutes as early as May 16, according to US Representative Mikie Sherrill.
title: NJ Transit Strike Would Be ‘Disaster’ for Region, Sherrill Says

description: President Donald Trump’s administration dispatched a senior official to Romania to monitor a contentious presidential election on Sunday, the government in Bucharest said.
title: US Sends Envoy to Monitor Romanian Election, Bucharest Says

description: Portugal’s defense investment may have reached an estimated 1.58% of gross domestic product in 2024, more than previously forecast.
title: Portugal Says Defense Investment May Have Reached 1.58% of GDP

description: Energy Secretary Chris Wright said his agency doesn’t plan to move forward with billions of dollars worth of Biden-era loans as the Trump administration reviews the department’s $400 billion-strong green bank.
title: Energy Chief Says US Won’t Move Forward With With Billions in Biden-Era Loans

description: President Donald Trump has set his sights on the pharmaceutical industry to shoulder part of the cost of his tax cuts, pressing congressional Republicans to force drugmakers to accept lower prices on prescriptions covered by Medicaid.
title: Trump Seeks to Squeeze Drugmakers’ Revenues to Pay for Tax Cuts

description: Chile’s government ordered coastal evacuations in the southern region of Magallanes and its territory in Antarctica, while President Gabriel Boric suspended his agenda on Friday, following a large earthquake off the coast.
title: Chile Government Warns of Tsunami in Far South After Earthquake

description: The US Treasury Department announced sanctions on three Mexican nationals and two Mexican companies involved in fuel theft and smuggling by the Cartel Jalisco Nueva Generacion.
title: US Treasury Sanctions Cartel Leader in Fuel Theft Crackdown

description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is scheduled to meet with US President Donald Trump in Washington on Tuesday, people familiar with the matter said, their first encounter since Carney won an election in part because of an anti-Trump message.
title: Canada’s Carney Set to Meet Trump at White House Early Next Week

description: Iran said it was “deeply suspicious” of the US government’s seriousness in the nuclear talks after President Donald Trump announced fresh sanctions on the Islamic Republic’s oil exports.
title: Iran Says Oil Sanctions Undermine Trump’s Seriousness in Talks

description: US officials have prepared a set of options for President Donald Trump to increase economic pressure on Russia, according to people familiar with the matter, as President Vladimir Putin drags his feet over attempts to end the war in Ukraine.
title: Trump Team Has Prepped Options for Pressuring Russia to End War

description: President Donald Trump declared that Harvard University would lose its tax-exempt status, a designation that has allowed the school to avoid paying levies on its revenue under classification for educational institutions.
title: Trump Says Harvard Will Lose Its Tax-Exempt Status

description: Some auto workers like James Benson Jr. are all-in on President Donald Trump’s trade war — and they don’t mind if it causes some short-term pain for both Wall Street and Main Street.
title: Auto Workers Welcome Trump's Tariffs - No Matter What's Happening on Wall Street

description: Source: Bloomberg, 13:24
title: Is Russia Recruiting African Women To Make Drones?

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: When Even Talking About US-China Talks Is Progress

description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is on track to become the nation’s first leader since 2004 to win consecutive elections, according to opinion polls, with his center-left government extending its lead over the opposition ahead of Saturday’s vote.
title: Australia PM Albanese on Track to Win Election, Final Poll Shows

description: Germany’s domestic intelligence agency formally classified the Alternative for Germany as a right-wing extremist movement, meaning authorities will have enhanced powers to monitor the party as a potential threat to democracy.
title: German AfD Party Categorized as Extremist by Security Agency

description: Israel struck a target near the presidential palace in the Syrian capital after the Druze community in both countries called for help following a series of violent clashes between the minority group and Syrian government forces.
title: Israel Strikes Damascus After Plea for Help from Druze Minority

description: South Korea’s former opposition leader Lee Jae-myung still remains the frontrunner for now in a presidential election that will struggle to heal the political divide in a nation racked by leadership chaos in recent months.
title: S. Korea’s Embattled Lee Remains Frontrunner in Leadership Race

description: The African Development Bank should do more to tap finance from oil-rich Middle Eastern nations and access the money held by pension funds on the continent as development needs grow, a contender for the institution’s presidency said.
title: AfDB President Candidate Advocates Tapping Middle East Finance

description: President Donald Trump ordered an end to taxpayer subsidies for National Public Radio and the Public Broadcasting Service, a longstanding goal of some Republicans who have accused the media outlets of bias.
title: Trump Signs Executive Order to End Federal Funding of NPR, PBS

description: Nigel Farage’s Reform UK has won a key parliamentary by-election following a recount, in a blow to Prime Minister Keir Starmer, fueling concerns in his Labour Party that he’s failing to slow the rise of the populist right.
title: Farage’s Reform Wins By-Election by Six Votes in Blow to Starmer

description: Small-value packages shipped to the US from China will no longer be exempted from tariffs starting Friday, when President Donald Trump’s move against an exception he called a “big scam” takes effect.
title: China Shipping Loophole Closed by Trump, Raising Prices for US Consumers

description: Traditional parties won’t be able to blame Russia. They failed.
title: Romania’s Revote Will Judge 30 Years of Graft

description: Lawyers of detained former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte have asked the International Criminal Court’s pre-trial chamber to nullify his case and order his release.
title: Duterte Lawyers Ask ICC to Throw Out Case, Order His Release

description: Nigel Farage's Reform UK could be on the brink of inflicting defeat on Labour in the first by-election test for Sir Keir Starmer.
title: Runcorn By-Election on a Knife-Edge as Recount Takes Place

description: President Donald Trump is asking Congress for deep cuts to domestic agencies and a boost to the military in a preliminary outline of his 2026 budget request to be released Friday.
title: Trump Budget Seeks 23% Domestic Spending Cut, 13% Defense Hike

description: South Korea’s former Acting President Han Duck-soo has entered the fray for the country’s top office, amid a flurry of leadership changes as the nation prepares for a June 3 presidential election.
title: South Korea’s Han Duck-soo to Run in June Presidential Election

description: President Donald Trump will request a record $1.01 trillion in national security spending for the fiscal year beginning Oct. 1, more than 13% over the current year’s figure, according to administration officials familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Plans Record $1.01 Trillion National Security Budget

description: President Donald Trump recently suggested he’d rather his administration didn’t use the Signal messaging app. A recent photo suggests his team isn’t getting the message.
title: Photo Shows Trump Team Still Using Signal Despite Controversy

description: US Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson denounced what she called “relentless attacks” on the federal judiciary, saying efforts to intimidate judges were threatening the Constitution and the rule of law.
title: Supreme Court’s Jackson Blasts ‘Relentless Attacks’ on Judges

description: House Republicans plan to raise more than $15 billion in revenue through increasing US oil, gas and coal lease sales, as well as other measures, to help pay for President Donald Trump’s massive tax cut package, according to a document seen by Bloomberg News.
title: GOP Plans Billions in Oil, Gas Sales to Help Pay for Trump’s Tax Bill

description: Vice President JD Vance said the US was working to ensure tensions between India and Pakistan don’t escalate into a broader regional conflict in the wake of an attack last week that killed dozens of people in Indian-controlled Kashmir.
title: Vance Say US Seeks to Stop India-Pakistan Tensions From Sparking Wider Conflict

description: China said it is assessing the possibility of trade talks with the US, the first sign since Donald Trump hiked tariffs last month that negotiations could begin between the two sides.
title: China Says It’s Evaluating US Talks After Weeks of Stalemate
